title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
snippet: Newcastle, dismayed by the news, hastened toYork and entered the city, leaving the Scots free to join Fairfax atNetherby, their united forces numbering 16,000 foot and 4,000 horse.

title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
snippet: We sauntered past Kirkandrew's Tower; across the river was the mansionof Netherby, the home of the Graham family, with its beautifulsurroundings, immortalised by Sir Walter Scott in his "Young Lochinvar,"who came out of the West, and--
